article.headline: Boston U. 62, Canisius 45
article.story: BOSTON (AP) -- Etienne Brower scored a career-high 17 points to lead Boston past Canisius 62-45 on Thursday, in a game originally scheduled as a homecoming for a Golden Griffins player who died earlier this year. Former Canisius player and Boston native Richard Jones died in May after collapsing during an offseason workout. Jones, who would have been a senior this season, collapsed about 20 minutes after beginning a workout with several teammates -- and under the supervision of the coaching staff -- and was later pronounced dead at a hospital. An autopsy revealed that Jones had a condition known as hypertrophic obstructive cardiomyopathy, a disorder of the heart muscle that generally includes enlargement of the heart and a thickening of the walls of the left ventricle. BU coach Dennis Wolff offered to cancel the game, but Canisius coach Mike MacDonald felt it was important for his team to make the trip. The Golden Griffins visited Jones' grave on Wednesday night and spent time with his family. Jones' mother, Delta Grant, attended, and a moment of silence in his honor was held before the game. "That was tough. (But) it was good for his family to see us," MacDonald said. "This was the right thing to do, come and play this game." The Terriers (7-2) put the game out of reach with an 21-6 run to open the second half. Rashad Bell hit three quick field goals in the post to give BU a 38-26 lead and open up the perimeter. The Terriers took advantage by burying 3-pointers on three consecutive possessions, two by Chaz Carr and one by Brower, to push the lead to 47-28 with 11:09 left. Canisius (1-6), which entered averaging 73.7 points per game, had its lowest point total since Jan. 28, 2002, and lost its fifth straight. Notre Dame transfer Omari Peterkin scored five points and grabbed four rebounds in his Terriers debut. Darnell Wilson scored 10 points and Kevin Downey added eight points and eight rebounds for Canisius.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
